section.section:
After December 31, 1997, a benefit certificate may not be delivered or issued for delivery in the State unless the form has been:
filed with the Commissioner; and
approved by the Commissioner in the manner provided for like policies issued by life insurers in the State.
Unless disapproved by the Commissioner, a benefit certificate is deemed approved 60 days after the date the form is filed with the Commissioner.

Each life, accident, health, or disability insurance certificate and each annuity certificate issued on or after January 1, 1998, shall meet requirements not inconsistent with this subtitle for like policies and annuities issued by life insurers in the State.

text.section: A society may specify the terms and conditions on which benefit certificates may be assigned.
